title: 01_introduction
text:
Let’s get started!





Robots are still far behind what many people expect them to be from movies.



One thing is certain: robotics will be an important technology in this century.

Vacuum cleaning robots have already been with us for over a decade.
Self driving cars are coming.

title: 01_introduction
text:
Good-old days


 


18th18^{th} century Europe was fascinated by automata such as Vaucanson’s duck, which was complex by the standards of the day.



Jacquard extended these ideas and developed a loom, which was essentially a programmable weaving machine.

title: 01_introduction
text:
Good-old days

The term robot was first introduced by the Czech playwright Karel Čapek in his 19201920 play Rossum’s Universal Robots.
The word robota is the Czech word for worker.





The first patent for what we would now consider a robot was filed in 19541954 by George C. Devol.
The device comprised a mechanical arm with a gripper that was mounted on a track.

title: 01_introduction
text:
Mobile Robots

The first generation robots were fixed in place and cannot move about the factory.
By contrast, mobile robots can move through the world using various forms of mobility.





Locomote: over the ground using wheels or legs, fly thorugh the air using fixed wings or multiple rotors, move through the water or sail over it.

title: 01_introduction
text:
Manufacturing robots




Typically operate in factories and are the technological descendents of the first generation robots.
Arm-type manipulators on a fixed base that performs repetitive tasks within a local work cell.

title: 01_introduction
text:
Service robots



They supply services to people such as cleaning, personal care, medical rehabilitation or fetching and carrying.
Must operate and move in a complex, cluttered, and changing environment.

title: 01_introduction
text:
Field robots



They work outdoors on tasks such as environmental monitoring, agriculture, mining, construction and forestry.



Must operate and move in a complex, cluttered, and changing environment.

Mars rover must navigate rocks, small craters despite not having an accurate local map.
Self-driving cars must follow roads, avoid obstacles and obey traffic signals, and the rules of the road.

title: 01_introduction
text:
Humanoid robots


They have the physical form of a human being – they are both mobile robots and service robots.

title: 01_introduction
text:
So, what is a robot?







Our definition of robot


A robot is a goal-oriented machine that can sense, plan and act.






A robot senses its environment and uses that information, together with a goal, to plan some action.
